translations: n.（古罗马）护民官；廊台；主教座（tribune 的复数）

sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, tribunes are arranged along the perimeter to accommodate on looking guests.
sentences.translation: 其中，沿着伸展台周围的廊台容纳观看的客人。

sentences.sentence: I think that your english is really funny, surely you have gone to the school on the tribunes of the stadiums.
sentences.translation: 在我看来，你的英语简直太滑稽了，你肯定去过体育场看台上的学校。（嘲笑他只会骂人）

sentences.sentence: These tribunes wore the narrow stripe on their toga . One tribune was someone who wished to embark on a senatorial career and thus wore the broad strip on his toga .
sentences.translation: 这些军团将校身着窄边托迦，而第六个军团将校则是力图从事元老职位的，他的托迦镶嵌的是宽边的绛色条。
